Name: The Maiden, The Defier, The Death Crier
QuestDesc: Truths, answers, and choices lie at the heart of the Inverted Tower.

Unlock.Name: Tales of the Past and Present: Avinoleum

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Still nowhere near finding Imperator. I'd better check on Abby...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You there, Abster?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Yawns)... What's up...?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It's taking longer for Abby to react...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, there's nothing to worry about... I'm just a little beat, that's all... Oh! Earlier when I was half-asleep, I came up with this great idea for finding the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's hear it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't the Sentinel say They're locked up in some kind of tower in the sky?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, how about I just fly up there and look for it? Easy as pie!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tower is either too far to see or it's totally covered by clouds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otherwise, we would've seen some sign of it on the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the shape you're in... are you sure you could fly that far?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C'mon, it won't hurt to try. The cliff at Egla Town would be a perfect launch pad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you wonder how to find the Inverted Tower Imperator spoke of, Abby suggests taking to the air, noting that the cliff near Egla Town would make a perfect launch pad.
Music itself holds no emotion. It's the heart that grants it meaning. So, dear listener, tell me. What feelings did my piece evoke in you?
Wow... A very valuable insight! Thank you, that brings me closer to completing my piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Salutations, {PlayerName}. My name is Ciaccona, a wandering bard. I'm glad to have met you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was sent by Lady Carlotta to find you. As I passed that abandoned house, I suddenly felt this... well, you know, rush of inspiration that just can't be ignored! So, I stopped to compose a piece...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surprise, surprise, the melody led me right to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I suppose this won't count as me getting distracted, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Carlotta asked you to find me, has something happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta told me you encountered the supposed Martyred Maiden—Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She dispatched search teams soon after, but there's been no sign of Cartethyia since.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why she asked me to use my Forte to recreate the frequency you experienced at the time, to see if any details you might have missed become clearer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recreate the frequency?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's a little tricky to explain in words... Think of it like being in an immersive portrait. Can you tell me about your meeting with Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more details the better. Even the smallest things count.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see here... Tweak a few notes here. Some emotions there. Textures... That should do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now then, {PlayerName}. Time for you to "tune in" to your memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter Ciaccona, a wandering bard sent by Carlotta to aid you. With her unique ability to recreate past experiences, she helps you relive your experience meeting Cartethyia. As you recount the meeting, you find yourself drawn into a strange realm conjured by her Resonance Ability.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ("Tune in" to my memories... Does that mean I'm supposed to see the past from another perspective?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Laureate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our Tacet Marks are glowing again. It appears there is a special connection between them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is the meaning of this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone used their Resonance ability to help me relive this moment, but this seems... unexpected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you first come to notice me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel—Imperator's voice guided me to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You heard the Sentinel's voice? Then tell me, am I Their Resonator?

Options.PlotLineKey: A question I have yet to answer myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, Imperator called you "the Lost," and Primus Fenrico claims you are the Resonator for Leviathan, the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you really don't have any idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I've actually been searching for the answer to this question, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My memories are fragmented. I remember becoming a Resonator, and the moment I was given the name Fleurdelys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I also remember fighting... something. But the details and the outcome of that battle are lost to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem deeply concerned about the Sentinel. Tell me, why is that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...? You rang?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! Check it out! Our frequencies got split apart.

Options.PlotLineKey: Right now, are we kind of like apparitions?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Basically, we're sorta in that "hover mode" you once joked about. Nothing new to me though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. Sorta, kinda.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be the frequency that's entangled within you. Is it some kind of Echo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... I'm experiencing a similar kind of frequency split. Though there is little that remains of my Resonance powers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feel its frequency weakening... I understand why you're eager to find the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said you heard the Sentinel's voice. Was there anything else They said?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They spoke of being ensnared in an inverted tower suspended in the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ensnared? Does that mean behind the seals there's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure you've noticed that "I" was drawn here only as a frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My true form currently resides inside an inverted Sonoro Sphere suspended high in the sky. At its center stands a tower, its gate locked by three seals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've sensed a voice calling out to me from behind them... Could it be the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say, it's really faint so I barely noticed earlier... Is that a Threnodian smell I'm getting from ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scent of a Threnodian...? You can perceive the Threnodian?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not an exact one-to-one with that big "Ova-thracula" meatball I had, but I'd never mix up a flavor I've already tasted.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby has a nose for these sorts of things. We came across Threnodian powers before in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it's safe to say Abby can be trusted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think I'm the Threnodian's Resonator?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we're making assumptions, let's err on the optimistic side first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Given your current situation, it is possible you were affected by the Threnodian's powers during your battle alongside Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That could be the reason behind losing all your power, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I take it this theory would benefit you as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, that unique Echo of yours needs the Sentinel's powers for treatment, does it not?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in adventure tales, it's not always the witch who loses her memory, it could also be a Blessed Maiden trying to regain her powers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, it appears we share the same goal of finding the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spending so much time alone in the Sonoro Sphere gave me plenty of time to consider countless possibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've braced myself for whatever may come until I find the answers I'm seeking.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to know what's going on with Imperator in that tower. And I want to speak with you in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can I reach your Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A part of the Sonoro Sphere is actually on land, though its outer perimeter is surrounded by a barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot leave, and no one can enter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid that won't do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That barrier also acts as the power source that maintains the Sonoro Sphere's integrity. If it's destroyed, the entire Sphere will collapse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the ruins along with the Tacet Discords it houses would come crashing down on Ragunna. It would be catastrophic.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said no one can get in. Has anyone tried?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I've occasionally sensed someone wandering outside the barrier as if searching for a way inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps they know something?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any distinguishing features?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Emm... Almost like a deep-sea jellyfish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I wasn't able to get a clear look. I can only describe the feeling I got from her as a Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would seem this Resonance ability can only last for so long.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll look for a way to find this person you mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something tells me you will keep your promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter the outcome, this may be my chance to find the answers I've been looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Under the effect of Ciaccona's Resonance Ability, you begin to view your meeting with Cartethyia from a different perspective. To your surprise, Cartethyia also "enters" this memory.

In your conversation, she reveals that she has lost most of her memories and is uncertain about the nature of her resonance.

However, her words offer new insights. The Sonoro Sphere where her body currently resides may be the Inverted Tower the Sentinel once mentioned. A mysterious wandering figure has attempted to enter the Sonoro but has always been stopped by the barrier. Finding this person's identity may lead to new findings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... {PlayerName}...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, thank goodness... You're finally awake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you feeling? Any headache? Tingling feet? Upset stomach?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... I tried everything, but you just wouldn't wake up. I thought you were...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait a second, did you actually fall asleep listening to my music? Oh... It kind of breaks my heart to know you reacted like that when it wasn't even a lullaby.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it was really helpful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Helpful for your sleeping troubles, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So my Forte created a special connection that led to some unexpected developments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl, is she friend or foe...? What truths lie behind the seal...? And who is that mysterious wandering figure...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a feeling this is going to be a very exciting song!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... I'll pass this information on to Lady Carlotta. So, what do you plan to do next?
Pardon the intrusion. {Male=My Lord;Female=My Lady} {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sebastian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Sebastian. As per Milady's instructions, I have been entrusted with the honor of inviting you to the Fisalia estate for a discussion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Fisalia family? The one that's likely worshipping the Threnodian?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why does she want to talk with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sebastian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Milady has expressed a desire to clear up some unfortunate misunderstandings that occurred previously.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell her I accept the invitation, but at a later time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sebastian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will convey your message to Milady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect the head of the Fisalia family to come looking for you, especially while they're still in the middle of negotiations with Lady Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's just as unpredictable as the rumors say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose you would want to know more about her before taking up her invitation, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's known to be a recluse and rarely makes public appearances. No one outside the family even knows her real name. They just call her the "head of the Fisalia family."

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard quite a few rumors. Which one would you like to hear first?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have "Shadow of the Ancient," "Lady Bane," or maybe "Entangler of Hearts"?

Options.PlotLineKey: They all sound like clickbait titles to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello... That's why they're called rumors. I'm just doing my due diligence by being faithful to the source material.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, ready to dive right in?

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't have much time. How about a shortened version?
Give me a quick summary. I'll get into the details later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... Long story short, the Fisalia family was one of the first to set foot on these islands and establish order in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their lineage even predates the Order of the Deep, and their craft of extracting toxins from aquatic plants is a legacy passed down through generations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Word is, they select the new head of household by having candidates ingest each other's poisons and wait to see who's still breathing when it's all over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stories about the current head of the Fisalias get even wilder. They say she didn't go through the usual selection process. Instead, she took the throne by poisoning her predecessor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Others say she's a master in the art of manipulation, drowning her victims in hallucinations until they agree to her terms without even realizing it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In any case, the Fisalia family aside, she's someone you definitely want to handle with care.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're set on meeting her, I'd be extra careful if I were you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The way she describes the head of Fisalia... reminds me of how Cartethyia spoke about the wandering figure by the barrier.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Can't rule out the possibility that they're the same person. Looks like I'll need to pay her a visit.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Ciaccona shakes you awake, and her reaction makes you realize that what happened wasn't entirely due to her Resonance Ability.

As you begin to consider your next steps, a butler from the Fisalia family arrives with an invitation to meet the head of the family.

You put off the meeting for now, opting to first learn more about the Fisalia matriarch. Ciaccona shares some of the most intriguing rumors about her, and a few details seem to match the wandering figure Cartethyia described.

Regardless of the matriarch's motives, this invitation could be the breakthrough you need. You say goodbye to Ciaccona and depart for the Fisalia estate.

Chapters.Title: Head to Porto-Veno Castle as agreed

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}. I received Ciaccona's memo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To think the head of the Fisalias approached you when I was still in negotiations with her emissaries. Was it meant to be a diversion all along...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They invited you and you alone. As a Montelli, I'm in no position to intervene.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That being said, if the Fisalias try anything against you, I'll get you out, even if it means storming through their front gates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the meantime, I'll keep looking for more information and the person Cartethyia mentioned to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll call you as soon as I find anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it.

Chapters.Title: Enter Porto-Veno Castle for the meeting

Dialogues.Speaker: Sebastian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One moment, please. I shall inform Milady of your arrival.
That won't be necessary.
To keep our honored guest waiting would be… most improper.
Especially when it was I who extended the invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella Fisalia—36th matriarch of the Fisalia family. I am pleased to make your acquaintance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honorable Laureate. The new Crown of the Carnevale.

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you seen my crown, by chance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. If you insist, I see no reason to refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may also call me Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... the Laurel is a gift of the Divinity. What claim have I to crown one as distinguished as yourself?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry, that was a bad joke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should be the one to apologize for not understanding our guest's attempt at lightening the mood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. You may also call me Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now. Shall we proceed to my study?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current head of the Fisalia family introduces herself as Cantarella. She seems to be well prepared for your arrival and invites you to her study.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Won't you have a seat?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope you'll accept this tea as my way of apologizing for the incident with Gilberto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Members of the family may have troubled you, but there is no stain that can't be washed away. Every sorrow has its own way of fading, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You still hold a grudge. Won't you accept my apology?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This tea... Is it from Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Let's set aside such past unpleasantness for the time being.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I invited you here to ask that you might serve as a mediator.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before we get into that, there's something I want to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I imagine it concerns... the Fisalia family's true beliefs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would seem Gilberto's mind is beyond saving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But let's not dwell on that. What is your opinion on the current state of Ragunna, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Peaceful, in a way that feels... wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've noticed something is amiss. As expected from someone who's felt the weight of a Threnodian invasion firsthand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what exactly do you find most unsettling?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why haven't the Threnodian and the Sentinel ever shown themselves?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because the Threnodian's invasion of Ragunna... has long since concluded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian, so named Leviathan, possesses the power to merge and assimilate. It uses distorted beliefs to spread a spiritual plague that slowly devours civilizations from within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the previous two attempts were thwarted, the tall mast of the galleon that is Ragunna has already been snapped in half.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now the blissfully ignorant masses walk hand in hand toward an abyss they cannot see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Friend or foe? As a newcomer to this land, can you really tell them apart?

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you implying the Order worships the Threnodian?
You're one to talk, given how strange your family's been acting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes and no. On one hand, there's the truth of the Order's beliefs…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the other, there's our family. The Threnodian doesn't take kindly to those who know the truth. We've always been under Its whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once the soul fractures, the mind will follow until only a puppet remains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that we've come this far, there's nothing for me to hide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My only hope is that once you learn everything, you will carefully consider my request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Based on what you previously learned from Gilberto, you confront Cantarella about the Fisalia family's true allegiance to the Threnodian.

Yet Cantarella unveils a more daunting truth. The Threnodian Leviathan is an entity with powers of assimilation, devouring civilizations through the spread of spiritual plague. Its invasion of Ragunna has long since concluded.

Peace is all but an illusion, blinding the Ragunnesi to the abyss they are unknowingly walking toward.

As if everything were unfolding as planned, Cantarella offers to present more evidence to back her claims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come. The truth you seek lies in the deepest part of the castle.

Chapters.Title: Leave the study and head to the deepest part of the castle

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is it.

Chapters.Title: Wait for the secret room to open

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you prepared?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that we're here, I'm afraid I can't let you leave. Even if you want to.

Chapters.Title: Travel deep into the secret room

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as I expected... The Threnodian "took notice" of you the moment you learned the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what you see in this sanctuary is the Sentinel in Their true form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A majestic steed that galloped with the wind, not a creature of the ocean's depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order worships a half-horse, half-sea creature Divinity, a form the Sentinel assumed only after being corrupted by the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although the Sentinel's will has yet to fade, who knows how much longer They can endure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}. I wish to ask you to persuade the Sentinel of Jinzhou—Jué—to come to Rinascita. To save Imperator.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's much easier said than done.
What makes you think I can do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In return, I will agree to whatever condition or request you make.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both Jinzhou and Jué owe you their future. That makes you the only person capable of this task.

Options.PlotLineKey: A Sentinel cannot leave its commissioned region.
Jué leaving Jinzhou would be a betrayal of duty.
Jué is still in the middle of a recovery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand the position you are in. Word has it that you're currently staying at a hotel and are at odds with the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps a stay at my estate would suit you, for the remainder of your time in Rinascita?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can offer you a glimpse into Rinascita's past, and you'd be spared the Order's unwelcomed attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There might still be a path forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta once helped me interpret some stained glass images. The story it told was very similar to what you've described.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only more biased towards the Order. It mentioned a maiden who would emerge as the Sentinel's Resonator and later save Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think that's also a lie?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Care to elaborate?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Describe to Cantarella what was portrayed on the stained glass.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The part regarding the maiden isn't entirely fiction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel does indeed appoint a maiden to be Their Resonator, though not in the way the Carnevale would have you believe. No, it's through resonance with a very particular artifact.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's not how Jué found Their Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's because Imperator wields the power to split and manipulate space.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With it, They can withdraw a portion of power. That power's frequency will match the Imperator's own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is how the Sword of Divinity—Tyrvine—came to be. A blade sealed with the very powers of the Sentinel, and the artifact used to select Their Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To resonate with the sword is to resonate with the Sentinel. Only the chosen one may hope to draw it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... what about Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Martyred "Maiden"...? The nature of her resonance is unclear to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps she resonated with the Threnodian, or perhaps with the Sentinel in its corrupted form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But choosing her could not have been the Sentinel's will. That's because...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Maiden was already dead.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you saying the real Maiden was already chosen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the past, each year the Fisalia family would hold the Divine Trials to select those with the strongest will. These young women would attempt to resonate with Tyrvine's powers—while Overclocked, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though none succeeded, some saw fragments of the truth hidden within the resonance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was one of them... There was a moment, where I glimpsed the Sentinel's corrupted form and the inverted ruin suspended in the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I also learned that only Tyrvine can break the barrier of that Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I awoke from that vision, I discovered a line of words inscribed onto my hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would never mistake my own handwriting. That is precisely why I am searching for other possibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The words were—"The Maiden is dead."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (An inverted ruin suspended in the sky... her and Cartethyia's descriptions bear many similarities.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If Tyrvine is the key to entering the Sonoro Sphere, it stands to reason that Imperator may have played a role in the Sphere's creation.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If I can confirm that Tyrvine was truly left by Imperator, at least it would prove that neither are lying.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cantarella said she was Overclocking when she tried resonating with Tyrvine.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That's exactly what happened with Jinhsi. Could Imperator be trying to restore Their power through a Second Awakening?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If that's the case... my permission should cause a reaction. That's one way to confirm what they're saying.)

Options.PlotLineKey: Can I get a closer look at the sword?
Would you mind if I tried to pull out the sword?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By all means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I suppose all that's left is its symbolic value.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, do handle it with care. It is a family heirloom... I've heard of your unique methods and formidable strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... Who are you really?

Options.PlotLineKey: You can call me the {Male=Blessed One;Female=Blessed Maiden}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's... Arbiter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... you're likely a far more special entity.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I have some information and theories of my own. Care to hear them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please. Enlighten me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella shows you Sentinel Imperator's true form and the twisted truths behind its history.

The Sentinel was originally a majestic steed, not the half-horse, half-sea creature now worshipped by the Order. This form was assumed only after the Threnodian's corruption.

With the powers of separation, the Sentinel infused the Sword of Divinity—Tyrvine with part of Their power to ensure Their Resonator, the Blessed Maiden, could be chosen in the event of Their absence. For generations, the Fisalia family held trials to find the true Blessed Maiden who can resonate with Tyrvine through Overclocking. However, after her own failed attempt, Cantarella uncovered a chilling message: "The Maiden is dead."

Cantarella now asks you to persuade Jué to help rescue the trapped Imperator.

You decline her request, but not without alternative plans. Before acting, you must first verify the truth of Cantarella's claims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Cantarella about the conversation you had with Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would never have imagined someone already considered a martyr could still be alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What surprises me even more, is the connection you have with the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We Fisalias revere Imperator as our one true Divinity. And yet here you stand, the Arbiter of the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would it be more fitting to address you as "Master"?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's get back to the matter at hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, {PlayerName}. I present my request once more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you willing to help rescue our Sentinel, and pull Rinascita back from the brink of chaos?

Options.PlotLineKey: I have my own reasons for finding Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand Cantarella Tyrvine. She stares at the sword for a moment before shaking her head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tyrvine can only serve its purpose while in your hands. You should have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only question now is how we reach Cartethyia and Imperator's Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can discuss it on the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're the one that Cartethyia sensed wandering outside the Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A question that you already know the answer to. Why bother asking?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although, being described as a "jellyfish"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After confirming that Tyrvine was indeed left by Imperator through your special permission, you tell Cantarella what you know about Cartethyia.

Given past events, Cantarella quickly believes you and suggests traveling to the barrier of the Sonoro Sphere. It turns out that Cantarella is the wandering figure Cartethyia mentioned before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a cable car in the lower levels of the Fisalia estate that leads directly to the Sonoro Sphere. The mechanism beside that wall can activate the lifts.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are all these mechanisms really necessary?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Convenience isn't the only reason for having them. Some were specifically built in case an outsider decided to visit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've reached the old seminary's undercrypt. The gateway into the Sonoro Sphere itself lies at its center.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shall continue on foot from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This area was clear of Tacets Discords on my last visit, and there's no Tacet Field nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could they have come from the Sonoro Sphere itself?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't think there would be Gulpuffs here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Interesting. I've never seen such little creatures before. Would you mind sparing a few for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'd better not ask what she plans to do with them...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The road ahead will not be an easy one.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly happened here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The second Dark Tide... It occurred right here, at the Avinoleum. The largest seminary ever built by the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It arrived on the very day the Blessed Maiden passed her trials and was crowned by the Order. A day when belief burned brighter than ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when the darkness came, none escaped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These days, what most people remember is the seminary disappearing into the sky. But in truth, the Dark Tide that should have spread across Rinascita vanished, along with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet due to a lack of records, the second Dark Tide slowly faded from memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was there when it all happened. Still an ordinary member of the family, watching it unfold from a boat just outside the seminary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't until later when I attempted to resonate with Tyrvine, that I gained a partial glimpse of the Sonoro Sphere's interior.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like someone inside the seminary did something to stop the spread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely. It could very well have been Cartethyia's doing. But, as with the first time, there's also the chance it was the Sentinel who turned the tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can sense the conflict within you, the temptation to trust your Maiden. But it's best to keep those thoughts to yourself, for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian knows where the heart is weakest and it is there it strikes the hardest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, it's never too late to place your trust when the evidence is clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... now is not the time, is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do the Fisalias have a cable car that leads directly to the Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before it became a Sonoro Sphere, it was a seminary known as the Avinoleum. The Martyred Maiden once pursued her studies there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A superficial harmony needed to be maintained between the Fisalias and the Order, and this underground cable car was intended to send scions of the family to school.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The elevator is merely a later addition I had built for easy access.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem perturbed. Are you still gathering your thoughts?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything that's happened has all lined up so perfectly. It makes me think it's too good to be true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to share a different perspective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rivers eventually converge into the same ocean. If a goal is mutual, then it is only a matter of time before they meet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our very choices and our will have led us to this situation. Not the wishes of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are quite different from what the rumors say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. And what rumors have you heard?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That you're a recluse, a mystic, obsessed with the crafting of poison, oh... and that you poisoned your predecessor. Those kinds of rumors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A recluse? On the contrary, I've been searching for a solution to the Sentinel's plight and rarely return to Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After most of my leads fell short, a friend at Mingting in Huanglong introduced me to the stories they were telling of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A friend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the affairs of Huanglong's states eventually land in one person's hands. Would you care to take a guess at the identity of this friend of mine?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Why not put the other rumors to rest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because the rest of them are all true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Chuckle)... I see it'll take more than that to rattle you, hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I assure you, this is no jest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We Fisalias have lived under the Threnodian's whispers for generations. Once the soul fractures, the mind will follow until only a puppet remains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the soul of the ruling head falters, Fisalia tradition dictates that the successor... usher them into eternal slumber, with a poison of their own making.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My succession ritual… well, an unforeseen incident gave rise to whispers that sparked those rumors.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...How long has this been going on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For centuries... every generation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Outside, they call me "The Bane." But historically, every head of the Fisalia family has carried such a title.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It just so happens that I am the most potent one yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gateway into the Sonoro Sphere is just on the other side of this bridge. This is the furthest I've ever managed to venture.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging from the bits of information the Sentinel gave me, Tyrvine is the key to entering the Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And who can wield the Sword of Divinity but a Blessed Maiden?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you said you left yourself a message saying that the Maiden was dead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I sought aid from the other Sentinels. It's a shame they all refused.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily, you've brought me a new hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Laureate. You have come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, I am Cartethyia. And you are?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella Fisalia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, a Fisalia... It seems your ties with the Order are more complicated than they appear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had the privilege of watching the Blessed Maiden's performance at the Carnevale once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm rather surprised. After all this time, you still look exactly as you did that day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you and I should be around the same age.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm also unsure of what's happened to me... I've been searching for answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be the Sword of Divinity—Tyrvine, the one with the Sentinel's powers sealed within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't have knowledge of this sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Memories flowed into my mind just as you entered the Sonoro Sphere, granting me information about the sword's origins.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cantarella said that only those who resonate with Tyrvine are granted glimpses of its knowledge...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you mind if I tried touching it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The question of whose Resonator I am... is now perfectly clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I am not the Sentinel's Resonator. Then that must mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't jump to conclusions just yet. That doesn't prove you're the Threnodian's Resonator, nor that you aid Its cause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Options.PlotLineKey: Things are more complicated than you expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This connection formed between the Sentinel and the Threnodian, the second Dark Tide, and the forming of this Sonoro Sphere...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right now, you're the sole survivor of whatever happened that day. You really don't remember anything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you spoke, I remembered a few more things. There are two other swords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sword of Discord—Hognis, and the Sword of Virtue—Haultir.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you remember three pedestals as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, did you see them too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Placing the three swords on their respective pedestals should break the seal over the main tower...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why would this information be revealed to me now...? Is this the Threnodian's doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we do nothing, we'll never get any answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Instead of speculating, we should use the clues we've gathered so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Maiden...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please. Cartethyia would suffice. I am but a fake after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've waited for this moment, this chance to save the Sentinel... and my family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will not turn back, even if this does turn out to be a trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the thought of the final answer troubles you, then I suggest you step aside. {PlayerName} and I will take care of this matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you are willing to overlook the possibilities of a trap, then there's no reason for me to worry and turn away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I underestimated your resolve. I'm sorry.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, how do we get up there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply place Tyrvine on the pedestal behind me and this tower will elevate itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Using Tyrvine, you and Cantarella enter the Sonoro Sphere where Cartethyia has been waiting for your arrival.

The moment you brought Tyrvine into the Sonoro, Cartethyia recalled certain information she had previously forgotten.

The seal surrounding the Inverted Tower can be broken by bringing Tyrvine, Hognis, and Haultir to their respective pedestals.

Is this a clue from the Sentinel, or a trap set by the Threnodian? Only by continuing forward will you uncover the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you said to Cartethyia back there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rather effective on someone of her personality, wouldn't you agree?

Chapters.Title: Acclimatize to the new direction of gravity with Cartethyia's help

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you all right? The gravity that occupies this space is the opposite of what you're used to. It took me some time to get used to it too.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why is this place upside down?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe it's to prevent them from falling to the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords. The Dark Tide. And these ruins themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I imagine it's also a symbolic reminder that our beliefs have been turned on their head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This view matches with what I saw at the time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until you get used to the gravity here, I suggest we travel via "Phaom."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the name I gave to a Gondola.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After being lifted into the sky, you finally view the Inverted Tower in its entirety, with the three seals clearly visible at the central spire.

With Cartethyia's help, you manage to keep your bearings despite the abnormal gravity conditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Gondola only has two seats...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, dear... I completely forgot about this...

Options.PlotLineKey: How about I go with Cartethyia first?
How about I go with Cantarella first?
How about I go with Abby first?
Can we make room for one more?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems I get to enjoy a free ride after you've scouted the paths ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now's not the time to be so careless after that promise you just made to Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should focus on learning more about this place from her. I'll be watching with great interest to see what you come up with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Chuckle.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't Abby... living inside your Tacet Mark?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, then, the two of you go on ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greed will get you punished, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid Phaom would refuse that suggestion...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The two of you can go on ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be arriving at the first waterrise soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A few details, if you don't mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeling nervous?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last time I tried to pass it like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Eek!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where were my manners?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I can assure you it won't happen again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the rest of the way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see it clearly now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You look distracted. Still thinking about what Cantarella said about fearing answers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...My powers are very weak, and many Tacet Discords roam the Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thus I've been limited in the areas I can explore. All I can do is sit here, lost in thought, trying to figure out who I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you afraid of knowing the answer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am afraid... but not of the answer. I fear never finding one at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Phaom"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Rumbles*

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The vines are remnants of the Dark Tide. Phaom won't be able to cross through them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's disembark here and find a way to clear the path.

Chapters.Title: Clear the Dark Tide remnants on the statues

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you feel any discomfort while we were clearing out the remnants?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing out of the ordinary... I felt fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose this alone is not enough to determine whose Resonator I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've helped a lot. Don't worry about that for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another waterrise is coming up. You planning to hold on to something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why didn't you tell me sooner?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way. You said the inverted gravity is to stop the Dark Tide from descending into the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all we've seen so far are just its remnants.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That's because this very waterway we're sailing on used to be the Dark Tide itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In these waters, gravity isn't the only thing that's inverted. Its very essence is, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Obstacles ahead. Let's get off here.

Chapters.Title: Try to clear all Dark Tide remnants on the statues at once

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd rather know I'm a villain than remain a wanderer, lost in a world without understanding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To live with no memory of the past... Would it be so different from choosing to end it all?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must find the answer... Only then will I know how to face the memories I still carry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for you, if I really am...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can take care of myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it comes to that, I'll still remember the girl who cared enough to worry about me.

Chapters.Title: Arrive at the Tower of Salvation

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should go back for Cantarella. Will you wait here for us?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope you won't mind the extra trip, Phaom.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Phaom"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Rumbles*

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It doesn't take long for Cartethyia to return and the three of you regroup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw signs of battle along the way. Is anyone injured?

Options.PlotLineKey: My life is flashing before my eyes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not hiding anything from me, are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your smile is rather concerning...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you seem to be in perfect shape to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if you say so, I can offer you a strong elixir. Care to give it a try?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh I insist. Here, take this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Up ahead is the Tower of Salvation. That's where the first pedestal is located.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tower of Salvation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. A name taken from the Order's Codex.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No longer shall you bear these thorns as a reminder. Forged from primordial seas... this crown shall grant a new identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys. Child of Divinity. The Immaculate One. Will you uphold the sacred teachings of the Order of the Deep?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Salvation. Unity. Ascension... Of these three doctrines, which do you choose?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I choose Salvation. I wish to be the Master's blade, striking evil, upholding virtue, and offering salvation to those in peril.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the name of Divinity, I bestow upon you this crown. May the blood of justice never run dry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through this sacred rite, you become the bridge between the heavens and the living.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From this day forward, you shall be the Master's sole receiver and herald.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rise, Blessed Maiden Fleurdelys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Prestigious Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: None but the Master shall ever have the right to command you to bend the knee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aaaahhhhhhh! I told you to stop sticking random stuff in here!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any idea how messed up and humongous that frequency was? It's gonna give me indigestion!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should ask you that! What did you do just now, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was dozing when bam! Outta nowhere a giant blue ball landed on top of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It almost squished me!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm guessing putting Tyrvine on the pedestal has something to do with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hey! It smells just as "unnatural" as that big gigantor back in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel of Jinzhou... If what our little Echo friend says is true, then the frequency that entered your Tacet Mark could be Imperator's powers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? But the Sentinel isn't even here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The power to split and manipulate space...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is reminiscent of the moment of Tyrvine's creation. Only this time the place of confinement has become your Tacet Mark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why would it do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe it was meant for the "true" Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Under the right circumstances, the one to wield this sword and enter the Sonoro Sphere would be the Sentinel's Resonator, the Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel entrusted Their power to the Resonator so that she could lend assistance when the corruption of the Threnodian altered Them. Quite logical, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't seem too thrilled about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Imperator set this in motion, then Their original plan has already failed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia, that means your guidance holds the key now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything else you remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... just remembered the day I was crowned by the Order, and the moment the Dark Tide descended upon us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't see the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is all I can remember...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that what you saw?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You witnessed it as well, Cantarella?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. I only saw fragmented, blurry images...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They seemed to belong to other places within the Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe this is where we should rest. We'll wait until sunrise.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can take this time to think about the clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the one who needs rest most of all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, it's still only a possibility that the frequency you absorbed is the Sentinel's powers. Rest now, to ensure it doesn't take a toll on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm gonna hit the sack as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boy, it's so cramped in here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As soon as Tyrvine is placed on its pedestal, visions of Cartethyia's past flood your mind—moments from her coronation and the arrival of the second Dark Tide. Cantarella, however, shares she witnessed a completely different vision.

Meanwhile, Abby detects Imperator's frequencies within your Tacet Mark, leading Cartethyia to grow even more suspicious of her own identity.

To ensure that these frequencies pose no danger to you, the three of you decide to rest for the night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean besides being squashed behind that blue thing? Yeah, I guess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen, I figured something out about that frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not a single frequency. It's like it's mixed up with something else, or kinda like... a piece of a cookie that's been crumbled in with everything else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why it's so hard to get a good bite!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To see if it was a threat... I can now say with certainty that it isn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since it's a crumbly mess, other than taking up space, it's pretty useless.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We might encounter something similar at the next two pedestals.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep an eye on this for me, will you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Will do! You can count on me one hundred percent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The night passes in silence. Cantarella is the first to wake and notice the subtle sounds coming from outside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything else you'd like to ask? I'll share with you all that I can remember.

Options.PlotLineKey: You don't need to stand so far away, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is "Paradise."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I take it you don't mean that in a good way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "It is a place where sickness, hunger, sorrow, despair, and dullness of heart cease to exist. There, deacons sing eternal hymns..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From a literal standpoint, this line describes the Dark Tide perfectly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the beginning, the Dark Tide would claim only the areas it touched, assimilating all life as its vanguard to clear the way for its spread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dead... they would grow mouths and sing hymns, day and night. They didn't need eyes or ears, for their purpose was to spread blindness and madness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even those who did not believe were drawn irresistibly to the Leviathan's creed. And for those already deceived, it was all but inevitable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When a soul is corrupted to its core, it will sing hymns without end on its sleepless journey to merge with the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when every faithful soul has returned to "Paradise," the land consumed by the Dark Tide will begin its pilgrimage, drawn by darkened skies, spreading its "gospel" to wherever it lands next.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The final act of the Dark Tide is.... the "Journeying Paradise."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the future you saw after coming into contact with the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes...

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was its name before it became a Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This seminary built on an island was not just a place of learning but also a sanctuary for raising dragon Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did they teach?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's scriptures, geography, history, and combat skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shouldn't a seminary focus more on cultural arts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This was a seminary reserved only for Resonators, so naturally, their talents were put to more practical use.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, the doctrine of Salvation emphasized the importance of combat.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sword of Discord—Hognis, and the Sword of Virtue—Haultir...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't remember anything else about Hognis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as for Haultir, it was my former blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it end up being one of the swords that can break the seal?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps we'll know once we find it.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's... safer this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should get some rest. We'll be counting on you again tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now what could you possibly want with me at a time like this?

Options.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia and I will take point again tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it true that the Fisalia family was one of the factions that started the conflict in that stained glass?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The leader of one such faction, to be exact.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was a long time ago. After their defeat, the union was disbanded under immense pressure, and the Fisalias gradually withdrew from the public eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this why you had no choice but to publicly change your beliefs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. The reasons for the Fisalia family relinquishing their pride and enduring disgrace are far more intricate than that.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long ago, Tyrvine was actually given to the Fisalia family by the first Primus, Napoli the Second.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the conflict had settled, he arranged a private meeting with the head of the family to reveal the truths behind the pilgrimage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He told the Fisalias that when he traveled through the first Dark Tide and reached its end, there was no sanctuary. Only a battlefield filled with darkness and suffering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The heavenly voices he heard were not revelations from the Divinity, but the seductive whispers of the Threnodian casting a lure for puppets to bite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I told you before, Leviathan is a Threnodian who uses beliefs to spread a spiritual plague. You see, it requires a puppet to carry Its voice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel realized the Threnodian's plots, and thus the first Dark Tide was launched as a hasty reaping of Ragunna and the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To save Ragunna from the grim fate brought by the Dark Tide, the Sentinel split a portion of Their power and entrusted it to Napoli the Second.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This power allowed him to imbue the Echoes with the strength to repel the Tacet Discords and purify the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this power was released through the lantern depicted in the stained glass?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The other part was kept inside Tyrvine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was in that very moment, when the Sentinel's power had been weakened, that the Threnodian corrupted and merged with Their body, transforming the Sentinel into the form you see today.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If what you're saying is true... the first Primus should've been on Imperator's side.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did the spiritual plague you mentioned affect him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although the Primus's body remained whole, his soul was torn apart, caught in the ceaseless struggle between the Threnodian and the Sentinel within the body they now shared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's power failed to shield the Primus from the Threnodian's influence. As the two Divinities vied for dominance, he... succumbed to many misdeeds against his own people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, during that private meeting, he confessed the truth to the head of the Fisalias and begged for release.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's why he passed so abruptly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family was powerless against the Order at that time. Our only recourse was to submit to their cause and keep the secret locked away in our hearts, waiting for the right moment to act.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were pretty harsh on Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I learned of those records' secrets, I had only seen her from afar... heard tales of her accomplishments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I would be willing to believe she stands with humanity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more I allow myself to cling to such thoughts, the more I must strip them away and think rationally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's only then that I can be certain these thoughts are my own and not the whispers I hear in the dark.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A trivial experiment. A test designed to find those with the strongest wills and force them into resonating with Tyrvine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet after trying for so long, all we got was the answer "The Maiden is dead."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I don't think she wants to continue this conversation. Better to stop pressing.)

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I want to ask about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... And I don't intend to wait around either.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you going to search those areas we passed before? Alone...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more clues the better, don't you think？

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh and take this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Afraid I've slipped something extra in? Or perhaps you're contemplating dinner with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just curious why the matriarch of the Fisalia family packs her own food.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Food is always an easy target for those who find me less than... pleasing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no knowing what will happen once Tyrvine is placed on the pedestal. It's best we prepare ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought I'd slip away quietly and avoid any fuss. But now, here I am, dealing with all of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're all here, how about a morning stroll?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're a lot feistier than before.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Need help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, this is where our paths must part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here for the Sentinel, why would you leave now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I saw yesterday caught my attention. It may be tied to the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And besides, I'd rather not spend the day twiddling my thumbs, seeing as your Gondola only holds two.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you sure you want to go alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such concern for me. I do hope to see the fruits of your labor when I return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mind if I take Tyrvine?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead, it's no use now that it's out of the pedestal... its energy is gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It may still come in handy.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'll add you in my Terminal. Call me if you need help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... I just might ring you up once things are settled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You open your Terminal and exchange contact information. Cantarella leaves with Tyrvine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
To verify her visions and improve the chances of saving the Sentinel, Cantarella decides to venture into the unknown alone.

After exchanging contact information, she sets off on a separate path with Tyrvine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only I could still fight...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone's doing their part. Don't worry, nobody's perfect.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waterway up ahead is completely blocked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That garden once housed dragon Echoes, now there's nothing left but Tacet Discords.

Chapters.Title: Take Hognis, the Sword of Discord
Head to the Tower of Unity

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you said back there... Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The way you were when you saw the Plushie Echo... it was... unexpected.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think "The Martyrdom of Blessed Fleurdelys" needs a rewrite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A play about you written by Cristoforo the playwright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, how did he portray me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... "I would rather hear the joyous songs of the masses than any solemn hymn of remembrance. Perhaps the Sentinel feels the same."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd never say that!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, no matter what anyone else says...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as you stay true to yourself, everything will be alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doesn't matter if it's the Threnodian or the Sentinel. They don't get to change who you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... Ha... Ha...

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys, my Resonator, why dost thou persist?

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why abandon thy oath? Why hinder the spread of my gospel?
