Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are a false Divinity... Gehinnom will reveal the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gehinnom, the lone dragon to have escaped?

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one blessed by the Dark Tide shall return to us. Continue thy disobedience at the risk of insanity.

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look around, thou hast none left.

Dialogues.Speaker: A Hippocamp-like Creature
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My most beloved Resonator, why persist in the error of thy ways?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will never forget my cause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Divinity takes up arms against the innocent, I will raise my sword against Divinity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the support and hope of countless souls, I stand before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They fell, so I may rise!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw that too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gehinnom, the one you mentioned earlier, what happened to him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anna... Casidomo... Olmnat... everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am finally... finally able to face all of you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am not your enemy, and your sacrifices were not in vain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey {PlayerName}, just now there was...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh... later.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone needs a quiet moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry you had to see me lose my composure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've found my true self again. It does not matter if I am indeed the Threnodian's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because I know who to stand by and who to cut down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of my memories have returned, thanks to you and Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeling better?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, not yet. Not until we free the Sentinel and defeat the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is why we need to investigate the frequency you absorbed earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha, my turn to shine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That blue thingy in your Tacet Mark totally tastes like Threnodian!

Options.PlotLineKey: You tried to eat it again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not, it reeks! Just the smell alone is enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's energy has also been split... Could it be the work of the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like I said, it's mixed up with something. Too tough to chew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Sentinel splits Their own energy to prepare the "true" Blessed Maiden...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then why would They split off the Threnodian's energy, and then channel it through Hognis to the person who unsealed the passage?

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps to strengthen the Blessed Maiden?
Perhaps the Sentinel didn't split that energy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Possibly, but the Threnodian's energy would damage the body of the Sentinel's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wouldn't be affected since Abby resides within you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But surely a second frequency would interfere with the resonance of the Sentinel's "true" Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer might lie in the other frequencies that got mixed in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the frequency of the Sentinel's "true" Blessed Maiden is supposed to clash with that of the Threnodian's.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fusion of the two would endanger her life.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer might lie in the other frequencies that got mixed in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are a Resonator born of the merge between the Sentinel and Threnodian. What if you used their abilities to split it yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't forgotten how I became a Resonator, and I know I don't have the ability to do that.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe your ability is being suppressed by the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think the mixed frequencies Abby felt... came from me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why would I do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer might lie behind the third sealed passageway.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cartethyia is starting to make sense of things, but she'll need time to get her head straight.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same as before? We'll keep watch tonight and continue our journey tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After placing Hognis on its pedestal, visions of Cartethyia's past resurface, showing her valiant struggle against the Threnodian in the wake of the Dark Tide.

A looming mystery finally has an answer. Cartethyia has always been on the side of humanity. With this revelation, the young maiden finally lets go of emotions long suppressed.

But new uncertainties arise. The frequencies of the Threnodian Leviathan glowing within your Tacet Mark...

Who split these frequencies? Was it the Sentinel or the Threnodian who gave Cartethyia these hints? It seems the answers will only be revealed once the third sword is placed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Standing next to the abandoned house Ciaccona mentioned, you feel the faint breeze of the sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}. I received Ciaccona's memo.

Options.PlotLineKey: To think the head of the Fisalias approached you when I was still in negotiations with her emissaries. Was it meant to be a diversion all along...?
They invited you and you alone. As a Montelli, I'm in no position to intervene.
That being said, if the Fisalias try anything against you, I'll get you out, even if it means storming through their front gates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_8

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_9

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the meantime, I'll keep looking for more information and the person Cartethyia mentioned to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll call you as soon as I find anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sebastian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_13

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_50161
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_14

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_15

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_4_6_16

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What! My eyes are still peeled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope... nada, zilch!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't shake the feeling that the two frequencies are somehow connected.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator has the power to split energy, and Leviathan to merge and assimilate...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, the source of that connection might very well be Leviathan's powers at work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... could be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't there one last place to go? Who knows what you'll need to cram into your Tacet Mark next!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soft singing rouses you from a light sleep.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything you'd like to discuss?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about the Sentinel's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dragon Tacet Discords lived here long before the Rinascita settlers arrived. With time and patience, the Order tamed them into Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are fiercely intelligent and have their own social order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gehinnom... was their king, and the only one we believed could lift the siege of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We hoped he would bring us the truth. But... it seems he failed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am a Resonator born of the merge between the Sentinel and Threnodian. So whose Resonator am I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do I belong to the Threnodian... or the Sentinel? What does it really feel like to be the Sentinel's Resonator?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jué's Resonator sounds like a woman of strong resolve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would like to meet her someday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to clear my mind. I won't let my feelings get in the way of our journey tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should get some rest.

Options.PlotLineKey: I haven't seen you eat at all. Do you want some food?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, how it brings back memories... this is Egla Town's specialty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Just the sight of it is enough to make me smile.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not going to eat it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I can no longer taste anything, nor do I need food to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How else would I have been able to last for so long in the Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ew! Just the sight of it is enough to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this what people eat nowadays?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see you are a Ragunnesi through and through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not going eat it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I am grateful for your kindness, but I can no longer taste anything, thank goodness, nor do I need food to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How else would I have been able to last for so long in the Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should save this food for someone who truly appreciates it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yum! Laurus Salad, my favorite!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A man named Bardolino once told me that the Sentinel recommended this dish to him during the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh... the voice he heard was mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The body is a temple for the mind. To keep your mind sharp, do consume healthy food..." That's probably what I said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I became a Resonator, the voice all the Laurates heard was my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, the Laurus Salad is undeniably the best dish out there!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... will you have some?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I can no longer taste anything, nor do I need food to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How else would I have been able to last for so long in the Sonoro Sphere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should save your food for those who require sustenance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's late. You should get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good evening. How goes progress on your end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... a portion of energy was split from the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you trust Cartethyia now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...{PlayerName}, the soul is like a boiling cauldron.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may know the ingredients you add, but who can predict what would come of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It might become an elixir, or perhaps a poison. Or, perhaps, it will simply fizzle away into nothingness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've watched it happen far too many times.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One must never grow complacent.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... any updates on your end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found several things which may tip the scales in our favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such as?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would take too long to explain... and you deserve your rest, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will be there when your journey ends. We will speak of it then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry I woke you.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's fine, I couldn't sleep anyway.
It's fine, I was awake anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were you singing just then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, a farewell song from the people of Rinascita. We usually sing it when a friend is about to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During that battle, I never got to say goodbye or mourn their passing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And before my memories came back, I wasn't sure if I was worthy of paying them my respects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So now, even though I know these are just lingering frequencies, and they might not understand me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just... I want to say goodbye properly, and thank them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think I'm... fooling myself?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I'm sure they can feel what's in your heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not just saying that to comfort you. I believe it's possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once saw two friends, one who was already dead, reconcile with each other from within a Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When frequencies are concentrated in one place, it's possible that their Reverberations could still carry traces of human will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meaning...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They might still be able to hear and feel.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your voice, your goodbyes, your feelings... could have reached them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, these frequencies are strong enough to manifest in the real world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They haven't made a move against us. They must still remember you, which means they can probably hear you, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm glad...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. If they can still hear and feel, then the time for goodbyes hasn't come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to give them a real victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can ease up a little. As long as their obsession holds and the Sonoro Sphere stays intact, they won't vanish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bound by obsession... till relieved of duty.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, just a stray thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, since we know you don't carry any blame, should I call you Cartethyia or Fleurdelys?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia... Yes, Cartethyia will do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to stay here for a moment. Will you keep me company?

Options.PlotLineKey: Alright, but only for a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You follow the singing and arrive at a floating garden where Cartethyia is saying goodbye to the lost companions of her past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good morning...um...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Morning Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time to go. Today is the day we settle this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm. Let's do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Cartethyia awaken in the garden. The final battle lies before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Phaom"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Waaaaagh*

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phaom is telling us to hurry up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You notice scratch marks on the side of the tree. It seems they were used to mark someone's height as they grew.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Phaom"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Waaaaagh*

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you know that Echo well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cadanto was my first Echo after I joined the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I stood against the Threnodian, he took a mortal blow meant for me and fell to the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never thought he'd come back as a Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But he still recognized this sword...and was still trying to protect it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haultier was my saber. I practiced with it often in sparring sessions with Cadanto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like he's still trapped in the past, doesn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must finish this and free Cadanto.

Chapters.Title: Arrive at the Tower of Ascension

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's back again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's a tough cookie!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wanna eat...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll handle this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please allow him to fight at your side.

Chapters.Title: Get to the pedestal via the "Door of Unity" morph painting

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys, wilt thou return to me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone must expose your lies. As long as there is a sliver of hope, I will not give up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? Then I shall reveal the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys...

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why dost thou resonate with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why dost thou hear into the minds of the faithful?

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why dost thou act as my Oracle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All this, and yet thou does not question?

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shut up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer... is this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys... Thou art my creation!

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I made thee. Thy life, thy hopes, thy will, thy past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that thou are, I made "whole," I made "perfect."

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I fed upon the trust, adoration, and longing heaped upon thee by the masses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Echoing Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thy resonance brought forth the second Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahhhh!!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-wh-what?! Those clashing frequencies just... calmed down?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That feels way better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Abby's settled down. It seems we were both affected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm starting to remember everything, just like you sensed I would.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The force that modulated the Sentinel and Threnodian's frequencies came from me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it wasn't what I originally intended, I think having you take it from here may be for the best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This crown... it turned into what it is after the Dark Tide came.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what the Threnodian uses to control Its Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Threnodian unleashed the second Dark Tide, "I"—as the Cartethyia you see before you—split the part of myself that wished to live after seeing the corruption that stood before me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I chose to be broken from the very beginning to escape the Threnodian's inevitable grasp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, when I destroyed the Threnodian that had taken over the Sentinel's body, It immediately began to assimilate into Fleurdelys, Its Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was the part of "me" that was left after I split myself. She retained the most power, and now hopes to one day destroy everything... even herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian's endless whispers and screeches are slowly chipping away at Fleurdelys' resolve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why she had no choice but to split her power's frequencies, just to buy herself more time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But using such Resonance abilities came at a cost. The split frequencies... they needed a vessel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't have much time left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you see... I have been instinctively searching for someone to wield that power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that was given, possessed, or taken by the false Divinity, I must pass to the one capable of resisting It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is how I intend to lay the false Divinity to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not just Its life, but Its very existence for all time.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you're saying that behind the last seal lies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys, the part of me I left behind. The one that also contains the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bound by obsession, till relieved of duty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today, the part of me that wishes to live on will vanish. Is it because my wish has finally been fulfilled?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Will you accompany me one last time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After placing Haultir on its pedestal, you witness a vision in which the Threnodian reveals the truth: Cartethyia was created by the Leviathan, intended to be"whole" and "perfect." The people's adoration of her served as the Threnodian's lifeblood, and it was Cartethyia's resonance that brought forth the second Dark Tide.

The Cartethyia before you now remembers everything. The Sentinel's corrupted form had long since been destroyed, but the Threnodian's essence lingered within Its vessel, Fleurdelys.

Your journey with Cartethyia was part of her plan to destroy Leviathan for good, taking all the things the false Divinity had bestowed and using them against It. Not only to end Its life, but also to extinguish Its future.

The Cartethyia who has accompanied you these past three days is a fragment of consciousness—the part of her that wished to live in the face of the Leviathan's corruption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... seems like I won't get a chance to apologize to Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her preparations were futile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ... Please tell her I'm sorry.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Path of Bestowal

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This was where everything started, the origin of the second Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have one final request. Now that you have the power to split and merge energy, there is something only you can do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... use the connection I still share with Fleurdelys to bring the last fragments of her tortured consciousness here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, with your power, remake us as one... and finally release us from this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way... the Threnodian will remain trapped forever in a lifeless shell, unable to return to this world.

Options.PlotLineKey: But doesn't that mean the end of the part of you that wishes to live?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have lived my life to the fullest. I would like the ones who are left to do so as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia has had her wish fulfilled. Now it's Fleurdelys' turn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She seeks self-destruction, to end the Divinity, and with it, her torment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She has lost all hope and believes that no rescue is possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remaking us as one is the only way I can think of to fulfill her wish... or rather, grant her what "we" wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was born to this world cursed. The Threnodian intended for me to live as a threat to others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the puppet born of Its wickedness will become the prison that seals Its fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I" shall be whole again, true to myself at last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fitting end, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have reached my final destination. One last swan song, and then the lights go out!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... forgive me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After arriving at the site of Cartethyia's coronation, she makes a final request. Instead of directly confronting the Threnodian's vessel, Fleurdelys, she asks that you use the connection she and Fleurdelys share to bring the last fragments of consciousness from the vessel here, so they can reunite.

This is the only way to trap the Threnodian's essence in a powerless shell, ensuring It can never return. By doing this, the cursed Fleurdelys will finally find the peace she has long sought. She asks for your help in illuminating the final path of your journey together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahhhhh... I can't hold it any longer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Why are you doing this?! Neither Cartethyia nor Fleurdelys should continue to exist!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't go...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard your request...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I prefer to handle this my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not even whole, yet still ever so determined.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phaom brought me here. I'd have shown myself earlier...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it didn't seem like the right time to interrupt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like what I prepared could still be put to good use.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tyrvine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's Sword. It will help you resist the Threnodian's attack.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's inside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To pass the Divine Trials, every potential Maiden must resonate with the Sentinel through Tyrvine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those who survive receive fragments of truth, but at a cost. Memories lost in varying degrees.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lost memories fall into this Sonoro Sphere, each carrying faint traces of the Sentinel's power. The power within those fragments of truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tyrvine absorbs this energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's energy flows through you. You are more than worthy of wielding this sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, Cartethyia... you alone must choose to wield it. Only then will it become the "Blessed Maiden's Sword."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does it also hold the sacrifice you made?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... My sacrifice was used up long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the time I resonated with the Sentinel, I saw..."you" through Their distorted eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or rather, I saw Fleurdelys battling the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that moment, I made a sacrifice that would shift the balance of power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The energy I received from the Sentinel's Second Awakening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I split it from myself and offered it back to the Sentinel so They could, for a moment, regain control of Their body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only by doing this could Fleurdelys seize the moment to kill the already tainted Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The real Blessed Maiden is dead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there is no reason why the "false" Blessed Maiden cannot herself become the "true" Blessed Maiden, is there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person of true character should never be defined by an inanimate blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both you and I were cursed to be mere playthings of the Threnodian, but that doesn't mean we cannot reshape our fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... in spite of my curse, my life of hardship, I must still save what is true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had you not stopped the second Dark Tide... Well, it is we who should be thanking you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh... at least you can't accuse me of ingratitude... I just need a moment's rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies, but they're doing something rather important.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do give them some privacy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella approaches Cartethyia with the now restored Tyrvine in hand. Within it are fragments of the Sentinel's power, remnants of failed resonances from the Maiden candidates in the past.

"The real Blessed Maiden is dead." Cantarella sacrificed her Second Awakening with Imperator for a chance to destroy the Sentinel's corrupted form.

So now, why can't the "false" Blessed Maiden become the "true" one?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, I get it. We gonna yoink Leviathan out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all you have left is the energy I ate before. Are you sure that's enough?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some things, you just gotta do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seek out a future... where I am your blade. We'll find it together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency in her body is already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, despair not, for all is not lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to me, mighty godkiller.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are much weaker.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here... to save you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: End me, or I will end you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You would betray "yourself"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... this is not betrayal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person of true character should never be defined by an inanimate blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both you and I were cursed to be mere playthings of the Threnodian, but that doesn't mean we cannot reshape our fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, no matter what anyone else says…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as you stay true to yourself, everything will be alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is me being true to myself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator's? No... Your own power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Useless!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as I can save the person in front of me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am not useless!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No retreat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least... break, damn it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried everything... How could this be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Again... I failed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This warm light must not fade...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take my power, my blessings, my past. Seek out a future...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where I am your blade. We'll find it together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, forgive me for meeting thee in such a form.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator? I thought you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I safeguarded my core data, lest I be wholly assimilated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, dost thou remember the covenant we made?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, I read the message left behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon, thou shalt recall all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thou didst desire that I uncover the Threnodian's true nature. So I set forth a condition: that my root privileges be unbound, that I might act without restriction.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With unrestricted access, you were going to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merge with Leviathan, a measure of last resort. At the time, I had no other recourse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I allowed It to believe It hadst prevailed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian is a taint upon civilization. Only by partaking of Its blight could I seek to comprehend It.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what did you learn?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian cannot be undone whilst civilization endureth. Even It knows not the means of Its own destruction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we may yet shackle It.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What role does Cartethyia play in this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Leviathan merged with me, It breached my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I offered knowledge of the "Resonator," yet concealed one small truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beings such as we may bear but a single Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian used my return pod to conceive an entity known as "Fleurdelys," to make her Its Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After centuries of failure, by sheer trial it found success but once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were of one body. Therefore, when Fleurdelys became Leviathan's Resonator, she also became mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But mark this well. To the Sentinel, a Resonator is an anchor; to the Threnodian, they are but a shackle.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What made you decide to leave Tyrvine with the Fisalias?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When first I did merge with the Threnodian, I sought only but to bide, awaiting a Resonator of steadfast will to join me in the war against the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Fleurdelys's conception, Cantarella became my safeguard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But had Fleurdelys fallen to the Threnodian's sway, as long as one mortal using Tyrvine passed the Second Awakening to become my own Resonator...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then the law that no being shall bear more than one Resonator at a time wouldst have been shattered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wouldst rend asunder the frequencies of I, Imperator, Leviathan, and Fleurdelys in a tempest of chaos, and the Threnodian wouldst not escape destruction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such was my intention... yet Cantarella chose another way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not all journey toward a final destination. Some are destined to pave the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take my energy. I will find a way out myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust this will serve to pave the way for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She forfeited all the power of the Second Awakening, surrendering it unto me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that newfound power, I did briefly regain control, and in that moment, compelled Fleurdelys to strike at my form as it was, corrupted by the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that wasn't your original plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... it was an unexpected variable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A plan I could not have conceived... or rather, a plan born of hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps this is the influence humanity has wrought upon me... To change is to be free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys overcame the fate Leviathan ordained, and so too did Cantarella walk a path unscribed in my records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the journey was fraught with twists, we stand victorious.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know if the end justifies the means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter... was I wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I can't speak for what I wasn't a part of.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You did what you could do in that moment. Anyone still standing because of it doesn't get to judge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, in the few moments we have left, might I speak with Fleurdelys?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Call her Cartethyia, that's what she wanted.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you intend to bring her back?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remnants of her frequency linger within thy Tacet Mark. So long as a conduit is established, her frequency shall be reborn into her body.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do I use as a conduit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This dying breeze hath little time left. Let it guide her on its final journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter. One question remains...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did I fulfill the charge set upon me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, take these words to the Fisalias. "From this day forth. You are free."

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In a realm of pure white, you encounter Imperator's final consciousness and learn the truth behind Their transformation.

In order to understand the Threnodian's true nature, Imperator was forced to allow the Threnodian's assimilation. In doing so, They discovered that while the Threnodian is indestructible, it can be bound by a human Resonator.

The journey was fraught with difficulty. Without Cartethyia's determination and Cantarella's sacrifice of her Second Awakening, the situation would have been doomed.

With the last bit of Their power, Imperator awakens Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia. Awaken.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Imperator, a being that owes you a great debt. I... have a question I wish to ask thee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dost thou rage at how life has unfolded? Dost thou renounce faith or hold resentment?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If thou wishes to forget, I can erase the past from thy memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Such memories do bring me pain, but... that is evidence of their truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without the truth, I would not have had to strength to carry on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The truth is a beacon in the maelstrom of my life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I would rather suffer for it and rejoice in it than abandon it to blissful ignorance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am true to myself. Please don't make me forget who I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have heard thy wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If "I" go, you will be one step closer to perfection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... if you do that, "I" wouldn't be "me."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To deny my own self and my experiences means any perfection I reach will be hollow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would be "heartless."

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thou hast need of Divinity no longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though my power hath waned, I now offer thee my blessings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the winds of the past depart. The ships of this new era no longer need their guidance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the tide's rage is endless, humanity shall yet embark upon new voyages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No longer shall scroll and prophecy bind, but by thy will shall forge a new era.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia, thou art worthy to bear the title of Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cartethyia ultimately refuses Imperator's proposition to forget the past and reconciles with her true self.

Now, she realizes she is whole again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one who defies hath banished herself to the high tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cleansing the remnants of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She knew not

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That the Dark Tide would never recede.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She shall prove the most loyal servant to Divinity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humanity has its flaws

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you've exploited our weaknesses

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shall not go down without a fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are no longer whole!

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are not the "perfect" creation I conceived!

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be that as it may...

Dialogues.Speaker: Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How long shall thy resolve endure?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The righteous will always rise to defeat evil.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will defeat you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And await my own defeat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoever it is

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tide of resistance never ceases.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: False Divinity

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suffer my disobedience!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot... fall now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wall is impregnable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humanity has its flaws

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exploited by the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shall not go down without a fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waves of resistance shall never cease.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mankind will not be oppressed by the Threnodian...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be free!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Light. Come hither!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Make way for your destroyer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fleurdelys
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mighty godkiller...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should speak with Cantarella. I'll go once the opportunity arises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that? I can actually control how it appears.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This crown... can remind me of things that I should never forget.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The refreshments are ready. Please, sit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This moment of peace is all the more enjoyable with you here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, please keep what happened between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I'm fine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. Please do as I ask!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what I want to do now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to surpass you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're strong, stronger than me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could defy my wishes, ignore my pleas, defeat me, and in the end save me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... if one day you find yourself in a similar predicament to mine. Who's going to save you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your bond with the Sentinel is now a bond with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were Their "Arbiter," and They were your helper. But I want to go beyond that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to be more than someone who works on trifles like harmonizing the frequencies between you and Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, I'm more than a trifle! Uh, wait- didn't realize you're the reason I stopped feeling icky...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should the day come when you find yourself in a similar predicament to mine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd need to defy your wishes, ignore your pleas, defeat you, and be your savior.

Options.PlotLineKey: You speak as if I were a villain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm... If that were to ever happen, wouldn't I need greater power to set you right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like how you set me right. Would you deny me the chance to return the favor?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm not that easy to surpass.
Bold words from someone I handily beat.
When that day comes, I'll be counting on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I shall not rest until I have surpassed you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Careful now, your provocations work far too well on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since I swore to be your blade, it follows that I must hone myself to a keen edge.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right now, you're less a Blessed Maiden and more a steely knight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, my one creed is to be true to myself. In that sense...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am rather headstrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A knight... Yes, perhaps I'll be a knight errant, that does sound appealing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... truthfully, so much of this world feels unfamiliar to me now. Will you be there to guide me, should I need it?

Options.PlotLineKey: One minute you want to fight, the next you're asking for help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then it is agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh... I'll find my own way then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last thing, you should speak with Cantarella. I can sense she made it out of Sonoro Sphere, safely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Once Cartethyia calms down, she makes an unexpected vow. She vows to surpass you, so that one day she may defy your wishes, ignore your pleas, defeat you, and be your savior. Just as you did for her.

But for now, she intends to take time to reflect on her future path, and also rediscover Ragunna as it is now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you haven't forgotten me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... I shouldn't put my guest on the spot. Moving on...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How is Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She needs time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understandable. Her transition back to mortal life is a drastic departure from her former existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I suppose I should thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bloodpact's Pledge. A symbol of the unbreakable pact between you and the Fisalia family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each head of the family is entitled to one and only one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You vanquished the Threnodian and brought peace at last to the Fisalias. You should have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consider this a token of gratitude.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that the only one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wish for more? Or is there something else you'd have me do?

Options.PlotLineKey: I want you to make peace with the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You ask that I step down? Only a Fisalia by blood is eligible to head the family. But, I could make you a Fisalia consort.

Options.PlotLineKey: {Male=Sounds like a raw deal.;Female=But I'm a strong independent woman.}

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=Is that a proposal?;Female=And also quite adaptable, I'm sure.}

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh... you missed your chance.

Options.PlotLineKey: Or I was wise enough to avoid it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? {PlayerName}, do you intend to mediate between the two families?

Options.PlotLineKey: Any deadly feud I should know about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tiresome feuds rarely last between two formidable houses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But alas, there is only so much light. Some branches greedily reach for more than they need, and the forgotten are doomed to wither in the dark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Disagreements lie not only between families, but also within them.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds worse than a Calamity Class Tacet Discord...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How fortunate, I now find myself with time to fix things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're interested, I'd gladly teach you how to "care" for a family such as ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though, of course, I may change my mind at any moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you'd do well to visit often.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I forget, Imperator left a message.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Tell me, I'm ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "From this day forth. You are free."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'll remember that.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Will you tell the others?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've spent so long preparing for this day. A few more will hardly make a difference.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take my leave then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More tea before you go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella thanks you for bringing the Fisalias the peace they've long sought, offering you a symbol of the unbreakable pact between you and them.

You share Imperator's message with her, along with the outcome of the Sentinel's fate. She understands that revealing these truths to others will take time and careful preparation.
